fine_dining.name: Restaurante Chikito
signature_dishes: Habas con Jamón (Broad Beans with Ham)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, historic restaurant with classic décor, once frequented by Federico García Lorca and his literary circle
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks in advance, especially for weekend dining
fine_dining.local_tips: Ask for a table in the Federico García Lorca room; the restaurant has historic significance as a gathering place for Granada's intellectual elite

fine_dining.name: El Claustro
signature_dishes: Suckling Pig with Sierra Nevada Honey
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining room set in a restored 16th-century convent with elegant vaulted ceilings
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least 2 weeks in advance, jacket recommended for gentlemen
fine_dining.location: Inside the AC Palacio de Santa Paula Hotel
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Juan Andrés Morilla focuses on seasonal ingredients from Granada province; their extensive wine list features excellent selections from nearby Alpujarra vineyards

fine_dining.name: Alameda
signature_dishes: Roasted Kid Goat with Mountain Herbs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, sophisticated space with minimalist design and intimate lighting
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks in advance, closed Sundays and Mondays
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Álvaro Arriaga creates innovative dishes with traditional Granada ingredients; the tasting menu offers the best experience with expertly paired local wines

fine_dining.name: Damasqueros
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, contemporary dining room with stone walls and modern accents
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead, request counter seating to watch the kitchen
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Lola Marín offers excellent seasonal tasting menus that change monthly; the wine pairings feature small producers from Granada and across Spain

fine_dining.name: La Fábula
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, contemporary restaurant with garden views inside a luxury hotel
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Ismael Delgado López creates artistic presentations of traditional Andalusian flavors; their 'Granada Experience' tasting menu showcases local producers and specialties

casual_dining.name: Bodegas Castañeda
signature_dishes: Berenjenas con Miel (Fried Eggplant with Honey)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic bodega with barrels, hams hanging from the ceiling, and lively authentic ambiance
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; arrive early or be prepared to wait during peak hours
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Granada's most authentic tapas experiences; order a glass of local wine and receive generous complimentary tapas

casual_dining.name: Los Diamantes
casual_dining.atmosphere: Bustling, traditional bar with standing room and a few tables, always packed with locals
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations accepted; avoid peak hours if you want a table
casual_dining.local_tips: Granada's most famous seafood tapas bar despite being far from the coast; the original location on Calle Navas is the most authentic

casual_dining.name: Bar Los Manueles
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic Granada tavern with bullfighting memorabilia and traditional décor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner, especially weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Serving traditional Granada cuisine since 1917; famous for generous tapas with each drink; their house vermouth is excellent

casual_dining.name: La Botillería
casual_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary tavern with rustic touches and a warm ambiance
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve for dinner; lunch usually accommodates walk-ins
casual_dining.local_tips: Great selection of local wines by the glass; offers more refined versions of traditional tapas in a relaxed setting

casual_dining.name: Café Bar Ávila
signature_dishes: Habas con Jamón (Broad Beans with Ham)
casual_dining.atmosphere: No-frills local bar with limited seating and authentic vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; extremely popular with locals
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for serving the most generous free tapas in Granada; order a caña (small beer) for €2 and receive a substantial tapa

casual_dining.name: Bar Poë
casual_dining.atmosphere: Quirky, literary-themed bar with eclectic décor and intimate seating
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; popular with international crowd and students
casual_dining.local_tips: Offers more creative tapas than traditional bars; each drink comes with a choice of tapas from their menu

casual_dining.name: El Bar de Fede
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, trendy space with industrial touches and a lively vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner; active social media presence for updates
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Federico Ávila creates innovative tapas that blend traditional Andalusian flavors with modern techniques; excellent cocktail menu

street_food.name: Piononos de Santa Fe
street_food.local_tips: The famous pionono is a sweet cylindrical pastry originated in Santa Fe near Granada; this downtown location offers the authentic version

street_food.name: Mercado San Agustín
street_food.local_tips: Historic market with food stalls; visit the bar inside for fresh tapas made with market ingredients

street_food.name: Shawarma King
street_food.local_tips: Popular late-night spot reflecting Granada's Moorish heritage and multicultural present; generous portions at excellent prices

street_food.name: Heladería Los Italianos
street_food.hours: 12:00 PM - 12:00 AM (summer), shorter hours in winter
street_food.local_tips: Historic ice cream shop operating since 1936; locals line up even in winter; try their cassata or leche merengada

street_food.name: Tetería As-Sirat
street_food.local_tips: Traditional tea house in the Moroccan style; perfect spot to experience Granada's Moorish heritage with mountain views from its terrace

coffee_shops.name: Café 4 Gatos
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, bohemian café with artistic décor and local art displays
coffee_shops.food_options: Breakfast items, sandwiches, and homemade pastries
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with students and artists; excellent place to experience Granada's creative scene while enjoying specialty coffee

coffee_shops.name: La Finca Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist, modern space with Scandinavian-inspired design
coffee_shops.food_options: Artisanal pastries and light brunch items
coffee_shops.local_tips: Granada's premier specialty coffee roaster; they roast their own beans and offer various brewing methods

coffee_shops.name: Bohemian Jazz Café
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Vintage-inspired jazz café with live music evenings and retro décor
coffee_shops.local_tips: Transforms from coffee shop by day to jazz venue by night; great atmosphere for both working and socializing

coffee_shops.name: Cafetería Alhambra
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Spanish café with history dating back to the 1940s
coffee_shops.local_tips: Historic café frequented by locals; traditional Spanish coffee culture with no frills

coffee_shops.name: Pan de Mis Abuelos
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Rustic bakery-café with the aroma of freshly baked bread
coffee_shops.food_options: Artisanal bread, pastries, and light lunch options
coffee_shops.local_tips: Best bakery in Granada using traditional methods; their breakfast menu features excellent coffee paired with their fresh-baked goods

bars.name: Bar Los Diamantes
bars.atmosphere: Bustling, authentic bar with locals standing shoulder to shoulder
bars.local_tips: Granada classic since 1942; the original location on Calle Navas is always packed; each drink comes with excellent complimentary seafood tapas

bars.name: Bodegas La Mancha
bars.atmosphere: Historic bodega with barrels, classic tiles, and authentic old-school ambiance
bars.local_tips: One of Granada's oldest bars with excellent free tapas; the house vermouth is a must-try local specialty

bars.name: El Huerto de Juan Ranas
bars.atmosphere: Stunning terrace with panoramic views of the Alhambra and Generalife gardens
bars.local_tips: The best views of the Alhambra in the city; reserve well in advance for sunset terrace tables

bars.name: Pub La Tertulia
bars.atmosphere: Bohemian bar with literary references, bookcases, and intellectual vibe
bars.local_tips: Named after the Spanish tradition of intellectual gatherings; popular with university professors and students; hosts poetry readings and book presentations

bars.name: Granada 10
bars.atmosphere: Stylish, modern cocktail bar with elegant design and sophisticated ambiance
bars.local_tips: Granada's premier cocktail destination; mixologists create drinks using local ingredients including pomegranate (granada in Spanish)

bars.name: Tetería Al-Andalus
signature_drinks: Tea with Mint and Pine Nuts
bars.atmosphere: Exotic Moroccan décor with low seating, lanterns, and ornate metalwork
bars.food_options: Middle Eastern pastries and light meals
bars.local_tips: Authentic tea house experience reflecting Granada's Moorish heritage; over 100 tea varieties available

food_tours.name: Albaicín Tapas Tour
highlights: Guided tour of historic Albaicín's best tapas bars
Tasting of 6-8 signature tapas
Cultural and historical context of Granada's cuisine
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; comfortable shoes recommended for the hillside Albaicín neighborhood

food_tours.name: Granada Market to Table Experience
highlights: Guided tour of San Agustín Market
Shopping for ingredients with a local chef
Hands-on cooking class of traditional Granada dishes
Lunch with local wines
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1-2 weeks ahead; morning tours only when market is most active

food_tours.name: Wine and Tapas in Historic Granada
highlights: Guided tasting of wines from Granada province
Visit to historic bodegas in the city center
Paired tapas with each wine
food_tours.booking_tips: Book 1 week ahead; focuses on little-known wines from the Alpujarras and Calahorra regions

food_tours.name: Sacromonte Cave Dining Experience
highlights: Traditional zambra flamenco performance in caves
Dinner featuring Roma-Andalusian cuisine
Cultural insights into Granada's gypsy heritage
food_tours.booking_tips: Book several weeks ahead; includes transportation to and from Sacromonte hill

cooking_classes.name: Traditional Granada Cooking Workshop
what_you_learn: Habas con Jamón (Broad Beans with Ham)
includes: Market visit, all ingredients, recipes, full meal with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 1-2 weeks ahead; begins with shopping at San Agustín Market

cooking_classes.name: Moorish-Influenced Granada Cuisine
includes: All ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with tea and wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least 5 days in advance; explores the Arab influences on Granada's culinary traditions

cooking_classes.name: Alpujarran Mountain Cooking
what_you_learn: Plato Alpujarreño (Mountain-style eggs, potatoes, chorizo, and ham)
Trucha a la Alpujarreña (Trout with Ham)
includes: Transportation to Alpujarras village, all materials, recipes, full meal with local wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead; includes transport to a small village in the Alpujarras mountain region

markets.name: Mercado San Agustín
highlights: Traditional market in the city center
Fresh produce, meats, seafood, and specialty products
Small tapas bar within the market
markets.hours: Monday to Saturday 7:00 AM - 3:00 PM, Closed Sundays
markets.local_tips: The oldest market in Granada; look for mountain cheeses from the Alpujarras and jamón from Trevélez

markets.name: Mercado de Abastos de Granada
highlights: Local market with authentic atmosphere
Variety of fresh food stalls
Lower prices than tourist areas
markets.local_tips: More frequented by locals than tourists; great place to find authentic Andalusian ingredients and observing local shopping habits

markets.name: San Agustín Gourmet Market
highlights: Updated section of the traditional market
Gourmet food stalls and eateries
Modern take on market dining
markets.local_tips: The renovated section offers a more contemporary market experience; good for evening drinks and tapas hopping under one roof

spring: Habas con Jamón (Broad Beans with Ham)
Tortilla del Sacromonte (Granada-style Omelet with Offal)
summer: Pionono de Santa Fe (Cinnamon Sponge Cake)
winter: Olla de San Antón (Bean and Pork Stew)
Migas con Chorizo (Fried Breadcrumbs with Chorizo)
